item.title: 早间竞价：日元交易员关注日本央行会议纪要，中国关注经济反弹
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 独家报道：最后期限临近，美国检察官建议司法部对波音公司提出刑事指控
item.description: 两位熟悉此事的人士告诉路透社，美国检察官发现波音公司违反了与两起致命空难有关的和解协议，因此建议司法部高级官员对波音公司提起刑事指控。【原文：U.S. prosecutors are recommending to senior Justice Department officials that criminal charges be brought against Boeing after finding the planemaker violated a settlement related to two fatal crashes, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: UPS 宣布以 10 亿美元向 RXO 出售 Coyote 物流部门
item.description: 全球最大的包裹递送公司联合包裹服务公司（United Parcel Service）周日表示，将以 10.25 亿美元的价格将其 Coyote Logistics 业务部门出售给 RXO。【原文：United Parcel Service , the world' biggest parcel delivery firm, on Sunday said it would sell its Coyote Logistics business unit to RXO for $1.025 billion.】

item.title: 保诚计划回购 20 亿美元股票
item.description: 保险集团保诚（Prudential）周日在一份声明中表示，该公司计划实施一项价值 20 亿美元的股票回购计划，最迟将于 2026 年年中完成。【原文：Insurance group Prudential plans a $2 billion share buyback programme which will be completed no later than mid-2026, the company said in a statement on Sunday.】

item.title: Ooredoo 首席执行官称，在美国限制向中东地区出口人工智能之际，英伟达将在中东推出人工智能产品
item.description: Ooredoo 首席执行官告诉路透社，Nvidia 已签署协议，将在卡塔尔电信集团 Ooredoo 在五个中东国家拥有的数据中心部署其人工智能技术。【原文：Nvidia has signed a deal to deploy its artificial intelligence technology at data centres owned by Qatari telecoms group Ooredoo in five Middle Eastern countries, Ooredoo's CEO told Reuters.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，苹果和 Meta 讨论了人工智能合作事宜
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周日报道，Facebook 母公司 Meta Platforms 已经讨论过将 Meta 的生成式人工智能模型整合到苹果公司最近发布的 iPhone 人工智能系统中。【原文：Facebook parent Meta Platforms has discussed integrating Meta's generative AI model into Apple Inc's recently announced AI system for iPhones, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》称，在马斯克施加成本压力的情况下，雅卡里诺对 X 公司进行了调整
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周日称，社交媒体平台 X 的首席执行官琳达-雅卡里诺（Linda Yaccarino）面对公司所有者埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）要求提高销售额和削减成本的压力，已经调整了她的内部圈子。【原文：The chief executive of social media platform X, Linda Yaccarino, has shaken up her inner circle in the face of pressure from owner Elon Musk to boost sales and cut costs, the Financial Times said on Sunday.】

item.title: 通货膨胀加剧，爱吃肉的阿根廷人牛肉吃得少了
item.description: 阿根廷人以牛排馆、广阔的牧场和烤肉而闻名，但由于三位数的通货膨胀和经济衰退，他们不得不勒紧裤腰带，牛肉的消费量比以往任何时候都要少。【原文：Argentines, famed for steakhouses, sprawling cattle ranches and asado barbecues, are consuming less beef than ever, forced to tighten their belts by triple-digit inflation and a recession.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空公司与空乘人员达成临时协议
item.description: 代表阿拉斯加航空公司空乘人员的工会周五表示，他们已与该航空公司就一份创纪录的合同达成了临时协议。【原文：A union representing flight attendants for Alaska Airlines said on Friday that they have reached a tentative agreement for a record contract with the carrier.】

item.title: Under Armour 将支付 4.34 亿美元了结 2017 年诉讼案
item.description: Under Armour 周五表示，将与 2017 年的一起股东集体诉讼达成和解，该诉讼指控这家服装制造商和首席执行官凯文-普兰克（Kevin Plank）在公司财务健康状况方面故意误导股东。【原文：Under Armour said on Friday it would settle a 2017 shareholder class action lawsuit that accused the apparel maker and CEO Kevin Plank of intentionally misleading them about the company's financial health.】

item.title: 美国财政部从航空公司权证拍卖中获得 5.567 亿美元收入
item.description: 美国财政部周五表示，通过拍卖美国 11 家主要航空公司的认股权证，政府获得了 5.567 亿美元的收益，以换取 COVID-19 援助。【原文：The U.S. Treasury Department said on Friday it received $556.7 million in proceeds from auctions to sell warrants in 11 major U.S. airlines the government received in exchange for COVID-19 assistance.】

item.title: VanEck 为拟议的现货以太坊 ETF 设定 0.20% 的费用
item.description: 根据美国证券交易委员会周五提交的一份文件，投资管理公司 VanEck 计划对其拟议的现货以太坊交易所交易基金收取 0.20% 的费用。【原文：Investment management firm VanEck plans to charge a fee of 0.20% on its proposed spot ethereum exchange-traded fund, according to a U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission filing on Friday.】

item.title: Sonic Automotive 称 CDK 的网络中断影响了其经销商管理系统
item.description: 汽车零售商 Sonic Automotive 周五表示，正在发生的 CDK 网络故障影响了其经销商管理系统。【原文：Auto retailer Sonic Automotive said on Friday that the ongoing CDK cyber outage had impacted its dealer management systems.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 美国大型科技股涨势或将捉襟见肘
item.description: 美国大型科技股的迅猛涨势可能会得到喘息，这给今年以来一直不温不火的细分市场带来了希望。【原文：A blistering rally in U.S. big tech stocks may be due for a breather, offering hope for market segments that have been more tepid this year.】

item.title: 债权人争夺资产，菲斯科走向清算
item.description: 电动汽车初创公司菲斯科周五在美国破产法庭上表示，菲斯科正走向破产清算，两个债权人派别预演了一场关于哪个集团将首先获得偿付的争斗。【原文：Electric vehicle startup Fisker is headed towards a liquidation, attorneys said in U.S. bankruptcy court on Friday, as two creditor factions previewed a battle over which group will be paid first.】

item.title: 需求激增，美国航空燃油产量增至 COVID 前水平
item.description: 政府数据显示，美国炼油厂上周以大流行病以来最快的速度泵出了航空燃油，因为他们希望跟上今年夏天创纪录航空旅行的预测。【原文：U.S. refiners pumped out jet fuel last week at the fastest pace since the pandemic, government data showed, as they look to keep up with forecasts of record air travel this summer.】

item.title: 美国监管机构挑出四家 "生前遗嘱 "有缺陷的银行
item.description: 美国银行监管机构称，四家主要银行的 "生前遗嘱 "存在缺陷--即概述银行破产或面临压力时如何安全清盘的计划。【原文：U.S. bank regulators said four major banks had shortcomings in their "living wills" - or plans that outline how they could be safely wound down if they went bankrupt or came under pressure.】

item.title: 解说员：美国工业如何应对极端高温
item.description: 酷热让美国公司改变了工作方式。一个常见的对策是：减少工作。以下是高温对几大行业的影响以及他们的应对措施：【原文：Extreme heat has companies in the United States changing the way they work. One frequent response: work less. Here is how heat affects several large industries and what they do about it:】

item.title: 苹果将推迟在欧洲推出人工智能功能，归咎于欧盟的技术规定
item.description: 美国科技集团苹果公司周五表示，由于具有里程碑意义的欧盟技术规则要求苹果公司确保竞争对手的产品和服务能够与其设备配合使用，苹果公司将推迟推出三项新的人工智能功能。【原文：Apple will delay launching three new artificial intelligence features because landmark European Union tech rules require it to ensure that rival products and services can function with its devices, the U.S. tech group said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国对 TikTok 的诉讼将关注儿童隐私问题
item.description: 据一位熟知内情的消息人士透露，美国司法部计划在即将对 TikTok 提起的诉讼中，重点指控这个流行的社交媒体平台侵犯了儿童的隐私权，而不是声称它在数据隐私保护措施方面误导了成年用户。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice plans to focus an upcoming lawsuit against TikTok on allegations that the popular social media platform violated the privacy rights of children, rather than claims it misled adult users about its data privacy practices, according to a source familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国信贷息差因政治忧虑而扩大，国债反弹
item.description: 美国投资级公司债券收益率与美国国债之间的利差已飙升至三个多月来的最高点，这是法国政治不确定性和美国政府债券反弹导致的避险情绪的一种表现。【原文：The spreads between U.S. investment-grade corporate bond yields and U.S. Treasuries have surged to their highest in over three months, in a sign of risk aversion due to political uncertainty in France and as U.S. government bonds rallied.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克的薪酬特斯拉告诉法官，股东投票应推翻裁决
item.description: 特斯拉公司在周五公布的一份文件中表示，特拉华州法官应承认特斯拉股东投票赞成埃隆-马斯克 560 亿美元的薪酬方案，并推翻她 1 月份做出的取消薪酬的裁决。【原文：A Delaware judge should recognize a vote by Tesla shareholders in favor of Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package and reverse her January ruling that voided the compensation, the company said in a filing that was made public on Friday.】

item.title: 美国银行监管机构发现四大银行 "生前遗嘱 "存在缺陷
item.description: 美国银行监管机构周五对美国银行、花旗集团、高盛集团和摩根大通进行了处罚，原因是它们在破产时如何安全解决所需的计划中存在缺陷。【原文：U.S bank regulators dinged Bank of America, Citigroup, Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase Friday for shortcomings in required plans for how they could be safely resolved in bankruptcy.】

item.title: 美国建议有针对性地限制对华人工智能和科技投资
item.description: 美国周五发布了一份被称为有针对性的规则草案，禁止美国在中国的人工智能和其他关键技术领域进行可能威胁美国国家安全的投资，或要求通报这些投资。【原文：The United States on Friday issued what it described as targeted draft rules to ban or require notification of U.S. investments in artificial intelligence and other key technology sectors in China that could threaten U.S. national security.】

item.title: 据《纽约时报》报道，波音公司有望逃避违反和解协议的刑事指控
item.description: 据《纽约时报》周五报道，美国司法部预计将允许飞机制造商波音公司因违反与 2018 年和 2019 年 737 MAX 致命空难有关的 2021 年和解协议条款而逃脱刑事起诉。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department is expected to allow planemaker Boeing to escape criminal prosecution for violating the terms of a 2021 settlement related to the fatal 737 MAX crashes in 2018 and 2019, the New York Times reported on Friday.】

item.title: 罢工的法国工人堵住埃克森美孚炼油厂的运货卡车
item.description: 周五，罢工工人阻止运送石油产品（包括汽油）的卡车驶离埃克森美孚化工法国公司位于法国北部的热罗姆-格拉文雄港炼油厂。【原文：Striking workers blocked delivery trucks carrying oil products, including petrol, from leaving the ExxonMobil Chemical France's Port-Jerome-Gravenchon refinery in northern France on Friday.】

item.title: OpenAI 收购数据库分析公司 Rockset
item.description: ChatGPT 制造商 OpenAI 周五表示，微软支持的 OpenAI 收购了搜索和数据库分析公司 Rockset，收购金额未披露。【原文：Microsoft-backed OpenAI has acquired search and database analytics firm Rockset for an undisclosed sum, the ChatGPT maker said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国因网络风险对俄罗斯 AO 卡巴斯基实验室高管实施制裁
item.description: 就在拜登政府宣布禁止销售俄罗斯卡巴斯基公司杀毒软件的计划一天后，美国周五以网络安全风险为由，对AO卡巴斯基实验室的12名高级领导人员实施了制裁。【原文：The United States slapped sanctions on 12 people in senior leadership roles at AO Kaspersky Lab on Friday, citing cybersecurity risks a day after the Biden administration announced plans to bar the sale of the Russian company's antivirus software.】

item.title: Spotify 在美国推出新的基本流媒体计划
item.description: Spotify 在本月早些时候提高了其高级计划的价格，并于周五为美国用户推出了新的流媒体计划。【原文：Spotify introduced a new streaming plan for users in the United States on Friday, after raising prices for its premium plans earlier this month.】

item.title: 美国 5 月成屋销售下降，房价创历史新高，抵押贷款利率上升
item.description: 由于创纪录的高房价和抵押贷款利率的回升使潜在购房者望而却步，5 月份美国成屋销售连续第三个月下滑。【原文：U.S. existing home sales fell for a third straight month in May as record high prices and a resurgence in mortgage rates sidelined potential buyers from the market.】
